intro: Sisyrinchium hirsutum subsp. dasyspathum, commonly known as the woolly blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features slender, grass-like leaves and produces showy, blue to purple flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit with a basal rosette of leaves and flowering stems that rise above them. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and broader leaves compared to other subspecies of Sisyrinchium hirsutum.
